intro: Pseudolithos cubiformis var. viridiflorus, commonly known as the greenflower stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of South America. It features compact, fleshy leaves arranged in a rosette pattern, which help it store water and reduce transpiration. The plant produces small, bright green flowers that bloom in spring, adding a striking contrast to its foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements, it is a popular choice for gardeners interested in drought-tolerant plants.
